question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What team did Garra Dembélé play for before 2018?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Title: The Unlikely Journey of Garra Dembélé: A Tale of Football, Identity, and Belonging

In the heart of Mali, West Africa, a young boy named Garra Dembélé was born with a passion for football that would take him on an extraordinary journey. From the dusty streets of Bamako to the lush fields of France, Garra's story is one of perseverance, adaptation, and ultimately, belonging. Growing up in a country where football was not only a sport but a way of life, Garra's talent was evident from a young age. He spent hours honing his skills, watching European football matches, and dreaming of the day he would join the ranks of his idols. As he grew older, Garra's dedication and hard work paid off, earning him a spot on the Malian national team. However, Garra's ambition didn't stop there. He set his sights on Europe, where the world's top football clubs and leagues beckoned. After a series of trials and setbacks, Garra finally received an offer from AJ Auxerre, a French football club based in the picturesque town of Auxerre. AJ Auxerre, founded in 1905, had a rich history in French football, with a loyal fan base and a commitment to developing young talent. The club's scouts had been tracking Garra's progress, impressed by his speed, agility, and goal-scoring prowess. In 2011, Garra made the bold decision to leave his homeland and join AJ Auxerre, marking the beginning of a new chapter in his life. As Garra settled into his new surroundings, he faced a daunting challenge: adapting to a new language, culture, and style of play. The French league was notoriously competitive, and Garra knew he had to prove himself quickly. Through sheer determination and a willingness to learn, he slowly began to make a name for himself in the Auxerre squad. The evidence of Garra's integration into AJ Auxerre is undeniable. In his debut season, he scored 10 goals in 26 appearances, earning him a spot in the starting lineup. Over the next few years, Garra continued to impress, becoming a fan favorite and a key player in the team's push for promotion to the top tier of French football. One of the most compelling pieces of evidence supporting Garra's affiliation with AJ Auxerre is his consistent presence in the team's matchday squads.
content.source_2: It's the year 2029, and the world of football is abuzz with excitement. The sport has evolved significantly over the past decade, with advancements in technology and training methods allowing players to reach new heights of athleticism and skill. Amidst this backdrop, a talented young player named Garra Dembélé is making waves in the football community. Born in Mali, Garra grew up with a passion for the beautiful game, honing his skills on the dusty streets of his hometown. As a teenager, he caught the attention of scouts from top European clubs, and soon found himself making the move to France to pursue his dreams. Years of hard work and dedication paid off, as Garra's impressive performances earned him a coveted spot on the French national team. But it wasn't until 2029 that he made the move that would change his life forever: signing with Arsenal F.C., one of the most storied and beloved clubs in the English Premier League. As Garra stepped onto the pitch at the Emirates Stadium, the iconic home of Arsenal F.C., he felt a rush of adrenaline coursing through his veins. The crowd was electric, a sea of red and white jerseys stretching out before him as he prepared to take on the best teams in the league. Under the guidance of Arsenal's seasoned manager, Garra quickly found his footing, his lightning-quick speed and agility proving to be a nightmare for opposing defenders. His first few matches were a whirlwind of excitement, as he scored crucial goals and helped his team secure vital wins. As the season wore on, Garra's star continued to rise. He formed a deadly partnership with Arsenal's star striker, and together they terrorized defenses across the league. The fans adored him, chanting his name and waving signs with his number on them. But Garra's success wasn't limited to the pitch. Off the field, he became an ambassador for his country and his community, using his platform to raise awareness about social and environmental issues affecting Mali and the wider African diaspora. As the 2029 season drew to a close, Garra looked back on his journey with pride. From humble beginnings in Mali to the bright lights of the Premier League, he had come a long way.
